posts.title: Ma’a al-Fidda
posts.excerpt: Ma’a al-Fidda (2014) A look at first-hand video accounts of violence in modern-day Syria as filmed by activists in the besieged city of Homs.

posts._title: Janez Lapajne – Selestenje AKA Rustling Landscapes (2002)
posts.title: Selestenje
posts.excerpt: Quote:Selestenje Selestenje (2002) Luka leaves for the countryside unhappy with the way his girlfriend Katarina has treated him. She follows him hoping that they could sort out their relationship. Despite the beauty and tranquillity of their surroundings they go through twists and turns that only intensify their crisis. When Katarina befriends the happy-go-lucky soldier Primoz, …

posts.title: Shades
posts.excerpt: Quote:Shades (1985) “Unfolding buildings drawn across the screen in spectrums of grey reflecting buildings in their surfaces cutting the sky into triangles.”Jim Jennings

posts._title: Ralph Foster & Charles Mountford & Lee Robinson – Namatjira the Painter (1947)
posts.title: Namatjira the Painter
posts.excerpt: Namatjira the Painter (1947) Australian contemporary art has no more interesting tale to tell than that of Aboriginal watercolour artist, Albert Namatjira. Namatjira was thirty years old before his hand first held a paintbrush. In about 1934 Rex Battarbee, a well-known Australian artist, visited Hermannsberg mission near Alice Springs. He took with him into the …

posts.title: Ainsi Va La Vie
posts.excerpt: Ainsi Va La Vie (2019) Ainsi Va La Vie (2019)A portrait of three women striving to forge their own rosy paths. The film was produced in 2019 by Nobuhiro Suwa as an commercial for a cosmetics brand called ALBION. It was once on YouTube, but now the link is down

posts.title: Dispatch
posts.excerpt: Dispatch (1979) Quote‘Dispatch,’ another black-and-white film, begins with oscillating greyish surface modulations that move sideways on the screen, rendering our view a partial window to some larger movement taking place. Geographic graphic ribbings then ascend, and as perceived, the thought occurs we might be watching animated film. A shadow of a truck’s front end appears …

posts._title: David Hamilton – Tendres cousines AKA Cousins In Love (1980)
posts.title: Tendres cousines
posts.excerpt: Tendres cousines (1980) With the outbreak of WWII, the sudden call to arms will send the men of a family’s estate to the front, leaving a curious adolescent alone with the remaining women of the house, in need of a warm embrace and, possibly, a daring kiss.

posts.title: Mister Johnson
posts.excerpt: Quote:A decade after he broke through with Breaker Morant, Australian director Bruce Beresford made another acclaimed film about the effects of colonialism on the individual. posts.title: Pagine chiuse
posts.excerpt: Northern Italy, late sixties. In the midst of the family crisis, with the parents on the brink of separation, little Luciano is forced to move to a religious college. posts._title: Ruijun Li – Jia zai shui cao feng mao di di fang AKA River Road (2014)
posts.title: Jia zai shui cao feng mao di di fang
posts.excerpt: IMDB:RIVER ROAD is the story of two Yugur ethnic minority brothers, Bartel and Adikeer. They set out on a journey across the prairies of northwestern China in search of their parents, skillfully maneuvering their camels over the vast expanse of dry ground.
